Area of sector and segment of a circle

  1. The portion of the circular region enclosed by two radii and the corresponding arc is called a sector of the circle.
  2. The portion of the circular region enclosed between a chord and the corresponding arc is called a segment of the circle.
  3. When degree measure of the angle at the centre is 360, area of the sector = \(\pi \times r^2\)
  4. When the degree measure of the angle at the centre is \(\theta \), area of the sector = \(\pi \times r^2 \times \frac{\theta }{360}\)
  5. Length of an arc of a sector of angle \(\theta =2\times \pi \times r \times \frac{\theta }{360}\)
  6. Area of a segment = Area of the corresponding sector - Area of triangle formed by the corresponding cord at the centre.
